repnme.cdata!:
Supporting Grenada’s efforts to ride
            through the crisis

abstracts.cdata!:
The World Bank has worked with Grenada
            to help the country manage the impact of the recent global
            economic slowdown, providing the government with a
            Development Policy Loan program in support of a number of
            key structural reforms. In particular, the aim was to
            improve public service delivery, enhance the country’s
            competitive position, and better manage the inherent
            vulnerability of a small and open economy. While reforms are
            taking longer than initially expected, the Bank is
            continuing to work with the government on this process and
            on necessary next steps, as the impacts of the global
            economic crisis are far from over.

docna.cdata!:
Supporting Grenada’s efforts to ride through
            the crisis

display_title.display_title:
Supporting Grenada’s efforts to
            ride through the crisis

repnme.cdata!:
Grenada - Economic and Social Development
            Policy Loan/Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Economic and Social
            Development Policy Loan/Credit Project for Grenada were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            a programmatic approach, which supports a multi-stage
            program with a longer term horizon, is superior to a
            stand-alone one year program. At the Regional Operations
            Committee meeting of this Development Policy Loan (DPL)/DPL
            held in December 2009, both peer reviewers of this operation
            as well as comments by other participants strongly supported
            a programmatic approach. Eventually, a stand-alone operation
            was favored because of the high uncertainty and debt risk of
            Grenada at that point in time. With hindsight, a
            programmatic operation could have had stronger development
            impact and, by presenting a schedule of possible future
            financial support. In small states, policy based programs
            need to be relatively simple and straightforward. Since
            generally only one policy based operation is prepared in a
            multi-year period, both the Government and the Bank tend to
            include many activities in the program. However,
            implementation capacity is usually not strong in these
            countries. Thus, in order to increase the likelihood that
            programs are fully implemented, it would be useful to design
            highly selective and relatively simple programs. In
            addition, following up with intensive technical assistance
            and country dialogue that builds local capacity would help
            during implementation and also enhance sustainability of the
            reform program in the medium term. The Program Policy Matrix
            needs to be concise, with few measures and outcome
            indicators that are clearly defined, critical for the
            performance of the Program, and that are within control of
            the government.

repnme.cdata!:
Grenada - Economic and Social Development
            Policy Loan and Credit Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Economic and
            Social Development Policy Loan and Credit Program for
            Grenada are to: a) improve public sector governance and
            economic management, by supporting reforms to increase the
            efficiency of tax collection, improve public service
            delivery, enhance debt management, reduce waste in the
            provision of public services, and help cope with the adverse
            consequences of the global economic downturn; and b) improve
            the effectiveness and efficiency of social safety nets, by
            supporting efforts to develop objective beneficiary
            selection criteria and transparent targeting mechanisms and
            prioritize social spending to vulnerable groups. Economic
            and Social Development Policy Loan and Development Policy
            Credit (ES DPL/DPC) will provide timely financial support to
            the Government of Grenada for: (i) managing the impact of
            the global economic crisis; and (ii) maintaining and
            reinforcing the implementation of the government's
            long-term structural reform agenda. The Grenadian Government
            developed a well articulated economic program in 2006 and
            has been implementing this program since then with necessary
            extensions and modifications as required by the changing
            economic environment. The macroeconomic performance remained
            strong up to the global economic crisis when the
            macroeconomic environment deteriorated sharply. Given the
            high level of debt and limited fiscal space, Grenada is
            significantly constrained in adopting countercyclical
            policies to mitigate the impact of the global economic
            crisis and needs financial support while it adjusts to the
            deteriorated global environment and sustains the
            implementation of the longer term reform agenda. The ES
            DPL/DPC will help the government in maintaining
            macroeconomic stability and protecting the poor while
            enhancing economic and institutional foundations for faster
            development. To this end, the ES DPL/DPC supports specific
            actions to: (1) improve public sector governance, economic
            management, and debt management; (2) strengthen social
            safety nets; and (3) improve the business environment and
            financial sector stability.
